introduction_english: Today, we're focusing on the word "いまに", which you frequently encounter when anticipating upcoming events or changes.
meaning_explanation_english: The word "いまに" means "soon" or "in the near future". It's often used when indicating that something is expected to happen soon. It conveys a sense of imminence, suggesting that an event or action will occur before long.
kanji_explanation: This word is usually written in kana, so there are no kanji to explain.
synonyms: 軈て : やがて : before long
synonym_explanation: The most common synonym of the word "いまに" is "やがて". Both can mean "soon" or "before long", but "やがて" can also imply a slightly longer timeframe and can be used more broadly. They both express expectation for something to occur in the future, though "いまに" often suggests a quicker onset.
antonyms: さっき : さっき : a short while ago
antonym_explanation: The most common antonym of the word "いまに" is "さっき". While "いまに" looks forward, meaning "soon", "さっき" refers to the past, meaning "just a moment ago". They reflect opposite directions on the time spectrum.

example_sentences.furigana: 今（いま）に 終（お）わるでしょう。

translations.MY: မကြာခင်ပြီးပြီးမယ်။

example_sentences.furigana: 今(いま)に雨(あめ)が降(ふ)ります。

translations.TL: Uulan na sa lalong madaling panahon.
translations.MY: အခုမတိုင်မီ မိုးရွာတော့မည်နော်။
ဆက်ကြည့်ပါ။

example_sentences.kanji: 彼はいまにわかると思います。
example_sentences.furigana: 彼(かれ)はいまにわかると思(おも)います。

translations.EN: I think he will understand soon.
translations.ID: Saya pikir dia akan segera mengerti.
translations.VI: Tôi nghĩ rằng anh ấy sẽ hiểu sớm.
translations.BN: আমার মনে হয় সে শীঘ্রই বুঝবে।
translations.TL: Sa tingin ko, mauunawaan din niya ito.
translations.MY: သူမကြာခင်မှာနားလည်မယ်ထင်တယ်။
translations.HI: मेरा लगता है कि वह जल्द ही समझ जाएगा।
translations.FA: فکر می‌کنم او به زودی متوجه خواهد شد.
